channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry told police failed in response to bombing
item.description: Police "failed" in their response to the Manchester Arena attack in 2017, an inquiry hears.

item.title: M25 protests: Activists return to Hertfordshire, Surrey and Kent
item.description: Police arrest 71 people as activists disrupt motorway traffic in Hertfordshire, Surrey and Kent.

item.title: Care home provider fined after woman raped by another resident
item.description: The woman was raped by a resident responsible for almost 80 "sexualised" incidents, a court hears.

item.title: Matfen Hall: Hotel U-turn after weddings cancelled amid price hike
item.description: In a statement, Matfen Hall says it was "never our intention to cause any upset".

item.title: Sebastian Kalinowski: Mother denies murdering teenage son
item.description: Sebastian Kalinowski, 15, died after being found unconscious in Huddersfield in August.

item.title: Woman's bravery praised as abusive partner jailed
item.description: Gloucestershire Police commend woman's bravery after Ezron Needham is sentenced to five years.

item.title: Wanted man rams officer's car with police dog inside
item.description: Police bodycam pictures show a suspect repeatedly ramming an officer's car to avoid arrest.

item.title: Duchess of Cambridge meets team involved in Afghan evacuation
item.description: Catherine speaks to those involved in the operation, which saw thousands airlifted out of Kabul.

item.title: Durham fire: Crews sent to Milburngate development
item.description: The blaze started in a wall of the shopping, leisure, office and housing complex in Durham.

item.title: Middlesbrough brain surgery patient left with clip under skin
item.description: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust says the patient was not harmed by the error.

item.title: Barrymore pool death: Stuart Lubbock's father Terry dies
item.description: Terry Lubbock, whose son Stuart died after a party at the entertainer's house, had terminal cancer.

item.title: British Pie Awards: Vegan bakes on the rise as contest returns
item.description: The 72 vegan entries make it the largest of the 23 categories.

item.title: Drunk driver with child in car smashes into lorry in Chesterfield
item.description: Declan Webster was racing with friends before the huge crash in Chesterfield.

item.title: Brendon Prince: Round-Britain paddleboarder completes challenge
item.description: Sea safety campaigner Brendon Price was escorted to shore by a flotilla of paddleboards.

item.title: The Birmingham LGBT café providing a safe space
item.description: The not-for-profit café has a "pay-as-you-feel" policy so people struggling financially can eat.

item.title: The litter-laden alleyways transformed by residents
item.description: Residents decided to turn fly-tipping-laden alleyways into vibrant community spaces.

item.title: Coronavirus: Matlock Bath Illuminations return after cancellation
item.description: The colourful event in Derbyshire sees hand-crafted boats parade on the River Derwent.

item.title: Culture of bullying and racial discrimination found at NHS trust
item.description: Inspectors say staff have been left too frightened to speak up about their experiences.

item.title: Yasmin O'Donnell death: Pregnant woman killed by drug-driver
item.description: Yasmin O'Donnell was "a beautiful person" her husband says after an inquest into her death.

item.title: Men sought after Matthew Carroll killed on Birmingham night out
item.description: Matthew Carroll died after being attacked on a night out with his son in Birmingham in August.

item.title: National Grid site fire shuts down power cable between France and UK
item.description: National Grid ESO says it expects to "continue supplying electricity safely and securely".

item.title: Lincolnshire pub historian gets dream job after mum sends advert
item.description: Marc Knighton says the vigilant matriarch told him the role would be "right up your street".

item.title: Liverpool 3-2 AC Milan: Reds pull off comeback in Champions League epic
item.description: Jordan Henderson's strike gives Liverpool victory in a remarkable Champions League group opener against AC Milan.

item.title: Manchester City 6-3 RB Leipzig: Last season's runners-up off to flying start
item.description: Jack Grealish scores a wonderful goal on his Champions League debut as Manchester City put the pain of losing last season's final behind them to beat RB Leipzig.

item.title: Nottingham Forest 0-2 Middlesbrough: Forest suffer sixth loss in seven games
item.description: Middlesbrough hand Nottingham Forest a sixth defeat in seven games to increase pressure on boss Chris Hughton.

item.title: Emma Raducanu 'hungry' to improve after US Open win - but not sure on Indian Wells
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu says she is "hungry" to improve after her US Open win but wants a few days' rest first.

item.title: Stoke City 1-1 Barnsley: Cauley Woodrow scores stunner as Barnsley draw at Stoke
item.description: Cauley Woodrow scores a world-class screamer to earn Barnsley a point in a hot-tempered draw at Stoke.
